meta.description: state agencies, departments, and intra-agency subviews

nodes.label: NY State Constitution
nodes.factoid: The foundational document defining the structure, powers, and limits of New York State's government.

nodes.label: Governor of New York
nodes.factoid: Elected chief executive responsible for enforcing state laws, proposing the budget, and appointing officials.

nodes.label: State Judicial System
nodes.factoid: Unified court system led by the Chief Judge and Court of Appeals, interpreting the Constitution and laws of New York.

nodes.label: State Budget
nodes.factoid: Annual fiscal plan developed by the Governor and enacted by the Legislature to fund state operations.

nodes.label: NY State Assembly
nodes.factoid: Lower chamber of the State Legislature, representing districts proportionally by population.

nodes.label: NY State Senate
nodes.factoid: Upper chamber of the State Legislature, representing districts by region.

nodes.label: NY Consolidated Laws
nodes.factoid: Compilation of permanent laws organized by subject, enacted by the State Legislature.

nodes.label: NY Codes, Rules & Regulations (NYCRR)
nodes.factoid: Detailed regulations issued by state agencies to implement state laws.

nodes.label: State Agencies
nodes.factoid: Departments that implement laws and deliver services in areas like health, education, and transportation.

nodes.label: Public Authorities
nodes.factoid: Legal frameworks establishing public authorities across city, state, and interstate jurisdictions.

nodes.label: Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA)
nodes.factoid: State authority managing NYC subway, buses, and regional commuter rail systems.

nodes.label: New York State Thruway Authority
nodes.factoid: State authority operating the Thruway highway system across New York.

nodes.label: New York Power Authority (NYPA)
nodes.factoid: State authority providing electric power generation and transmission.

nodes.label: Dormitory Authority (DASNY)
nodes.factoid: State authority financing construction of schools, hospitals, and public facilities.

nodes.label: Empire State Development (ESD)
nodes.factoid: State authority for economic development and business incentives.

nodes.label: Battery Park City Authority (BPCA)
nodes.factoid: State authority managing Battery Park City neighborhood in Manhattan.

nodes.label: Roosevelt Island Operating Corporation (RIOC)
nodes.factoid: State authority overseeing Roosevelt Island operations.

nodes.label: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
nodes.factoid: Bi-state agency managing bridges, tunnels, airports, and seaports in the NY-NJ region.

nodes.label: New York City Housing Authority (NYCHA)
nodes.factoid: City public authority providing affordable housing for NYC residents.

nodes.label: Court of Appeals
nodes.factoid: New York's highest court with seven judges serving as final interpreter of state constitution and law.

nodes.label: Appellate Divisions
nodes.factoid: Four intermediate appellate courts covering different regions that hear appeals from trial courts statewide.

nodes.label: Appellate Terms
nodes.factoid: Specialized appellate courts in First and Second Departments hearing appeals from lower courts in NYC metro area.

nodes.label: Supreme Court
nodes.factoid: Trial-level court of general jurisdiction handling major civil cases, felonies, and matrimonial matters.

nodes.label: County Court
nodes.factoid: Trial courts outside NYC with jurisdiction over felonies, civil cases, and appeals from local courts.

nodes.label: Family Court
nodes.factoid: Handles family law matters including custody, support, paternity, juvenile delinquency, and child welfare cases.

nodes.label: Surrogate's Court
nodes.factoid: Specialized court managing wills, estates, trusts, adoptions, and guardianship proceedings.

nodes.label: Court of Claims
nodes.factoid: Exclusive jurisdiction over monetary claims and lawsuits against New York State government.

nodes.label: NYC Civil and Criminal Courts
nodes.factoid: Local courts handling misdemeanors, violations, small claims, housing disputes, and civil matters up to $50,000.

nodes.label: District Courts
nodes.factoid: Local trial courts in Nassau and Suffolk counties handling civil, criminal, and housing matters.

nodes.label: City Courts
nodes.factoid: Local courts in 61 cities outside NYC with jurisdiction over misdemeanors, violations, and small civil claims.

nodes.label: Town and Village Justice Courts
nodes.factoid: Local courts handling traffic violations, minor criminal matters, and small claims in towns and villages statewide.

nodes.label: Department of State
nodes.factoid: Maintains business records, oversees licensing programs, and provides technical assistance to local governments.

nodes.label: Department of Transportation
nodes.factoid: Maintains state highways, bridges, and public transportation infrastructure across New York.

nodes.label: Department of Health
nodes.factoid: Protects public health through disease prevention, hospital oversight, and health policy development.

nodes.label: State Education Department
nodes.factoid: Oversees K-12 education, SUNY system, professional licensing, and cultural institutions statewide.

nodes.label: Department of Environmental Conservation
nodes.factoid: Protects natural resources and environment through regulation, conservation, and enforcement programs.

nodes.label: Department of Labor
nodes.factoid: Administers unemployment insurance, enforces labor standards, and promotes workforce development.

nodes.label: Department of Taxation and Finance
nodes.factoid: Collects state taxes, administers tax policy, and enforces tax compliance across New York.

nodes.label: Department of Corrections and Community Supervision
nodes.factoid: Operates state prisons and supervises individuals on parole throughout New York.

nodes.label: Division of Criminal Justice Services
nodes.factoid: Provides criminal justice data, training, and grant funding to law enforcement and courts statewide.

nodes.label: Department of Motor Vehicles
nodes.factoid: Issues driver licenses and vehicle registrations while enforcing traffic safety regulations.

nodes.label: Department of Agriculture and Markets
nodes.factoid: Supports agriculture industry, ensures food safety, and regulates weights and measures.

nodes.label: Department of Financial Services
nodes.factoid: Regulates banking, insurance, and financial services industries to protect consumers.

nodes.label: Office of Temporary and Disability Assistance
nodes.factoid: Administers public assistance programs, emergency aid, and disability benefits across New York.

nodes.label: Office of Children and Family Services
nodes.factoid: Oversees child welfare system, youth programs, and child care licensing statewide.

nodes.label: Office of Mental Health
nodes.factoid: Operates psychiatric facilities and coordinates mental health services and policy throughout New York.

nodes.label: Office of Addiction Services and Supports
nodes.factoid: Provides substance abuse treatment, prevention programs, and recovery support services statewide.

nodes.label: Office for People With Developmental Disabilities
nodes.factoid: Delivers services and supports for individuals with developmental disabilities across New York.

nodes.label: Division of Homeland Security and Emergency Services
nodes.factoid: Coordinates emergency management, disaster preparedness, and homeland security initiatives statewide.

nodes.label: New York State Police
nodes.factoid: Provides state law enforcement, highway patrol, and criminal investigation services across New York.

nodes.label: Division of Housing and Community Renewal
nodes.factoid: Oversees affordable housing programs, rent regulation, and community development initiatives.

nodes.label: Empire State Development
nodes.factoid: Promotes economic development, business attraction, and job creation across New York State.

nodes.label: Office of General Services
nodes.factoid: Manages state buildings, procurement, real estate, and administrative services for state agencies.

nodes.label: Department of Civil Service
nodes.factoid: Administers civil service exams, manages public employee hiring, and oversees personnel policies.

nodes.label: Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation
nodes.factoid: Manages 180 state parks and 35 historic sites while preserving natural and cultural resources.

nodes.label: Division of Military and Naval Affairs
nodes.factoid: Commands New York Army and Air National Guard while coordinating state military emergency response.

nodes.label: Division of Veterans' Services
nodes.factoid: Provides benefits counseling, claims assistance, and support services for New York State veterans.

nodes.label: Gaming Commission
nodes.factoid: Regulates casino gaming, horse racing, and lottery operations throughout New York State.

nodes.label: Metropolitan Transportation Authority
nodes.factoid: Public benefit corporation operating NYC subways, buses, commuter rail, and regional transportation services.

nodes.label: New York Power Authority
nodes.factoid: State-owned electric utility providing hydroelectric power and managing energy infrastructure across New York.

nodes.label: New York State Thruway Authority
nodes.factoid: Operates and maintains the 570-mile New York State Thruway toll road system.

nodes.label: Division of the Budget
nodes.factoid: Prepares governor's annual budget proposal and monitors state agency spending and fiscal planning.

nodes.label: Attorney General
nodes.factoid: Statewide elected chief legal officer providing consumer protection, civil enforcement, and legal representation.

nodes.label: Commission on Judicial Nomination
nodes.factoid: Independent commission that screens and nominates candidates for New York Court of Appeals appointments.

nodes.label: NY State Voters
nodes.factoid: Registered voters who elect state officials, legislators, and vote on statewide ballot propositions.

nodes.label: Public
nodes.factoid: General public participating in state rulemaking through comment periods and public hearings.

nodes.label: Uniformed Force
nodes.factoid: Comprises approximately 5,000 sworn troopers conducting patrol, criminal investigations, and traffic enforcement across New York State's highways and rural areas.

nodes.label: Bureau of Criminal Investigation
nodes.factoid: Conducts major crime investigations including homicides, organized crime, narcotics, computer crime, and forensic analysis through specialized units statewide.

nodes.label: Field Command
nodes.factoid: Oversees troop operations across 10 geographic troops covering all of New York State, coordinating patrol and emergency response at regional level.

nodes.label: Office of Design
nodes.factoid: Plans and designs highway construction projects, bridge replacements, and transportation infrastructure improvements across the state's 17,000 miles of highways.

nodes.label: Office of Operations and Asset Management
nodes.factoid: Maintains state highways and bridges through 11 regional offices, manages snow removal operations, and conducts bridge inspections for 7,800+ state bridges.

nodes.label: Office of Traffic Safety and Mobility
nodes.factoid: Manages traffic signal systems, implements safety improvements, administers federal highway safety grants, and coordinates intelligent transportation systems.

nodes.label: Office of Construction
nodes.factoid: Oversees execution of capital construction projects, manages contractor relationships, and ensures quality control for billions in annual infrastructure spending.

nodes.label: Division of Air Resources
nodes.factoid: Regulates air quality, issues air pollution permits, monitors emissions from industrial facilities, and enforces Clean Air Act requirements statewide.

nodes.label: Division of Water
nodes.factoid: Protects water quality through SPDES permits, manages drinking water programs, regulates wastewater treatment, and oversees wetlands protection across New York.

nodes.label: Division of Lands and Forests
nodes.factoid: Manages 4.6 million acres of state forest preserve in Adirondack and Catskill Parks, administers forest rangers, and oversees recreational use.

nodes.label: Division of Fish and Wildlife
nodes.factoid: Manages hunting and fishing programs, issues licenses, stocks waterways, conducts wildlife research, and enforces Environmental Conservation Law through ECOs.

nodes.label: Division of Environmental Remediation
nodes.factoid: Oversees Superfund cleanup sites, brownfield redevelopment programs, petroleum spill response, and hazardous waste facility regulation across the state.

nodes.label: Office of Public Health
nodes.factoid: Conducts disease surveillance, manages immunization programs, responds to infectious disease outbreaks, and coordinates emergency preparedness for public health threats.

nodes.label: Office of Quality and Patient Safety
nodes.factoid: Licenses and surveys hospitals, nursing homes, and healthcare facilities for compliance with state health codes and federal Medicare/Medicaid standards.

nodes.label: Office of Health Insurance Programs
nodes.factoid: Administers Medicaid and Child Health Plus programs serving over 7 million New Yorkers, processes eligibility, manages provider payments, and oversees managed care plans.

nodes.label: Office of Primary Care and Health Systems Management
nodes.factoid: Oversees community health centers, rural health programs, and primary care workforce development to ensure access to healthcare across underserved areas.

nodes.label: Office of Instructional Services
nodes.factoid: Sets curriculum standards, develops Regents examinations, oversees teacher certification, and provides guidance on instructional programs to 700+ school districts.

nodes.label: Office of School Operations and Management Services
nodes.factoid: Reviews district budgets, oversees school construction aid, manages transportation aid, and provides administrative guidance to school districts statewide.

nodes.label: Office of Special Education
nodes.factoid: Ensures compliance with IDEA, provides technical assistance on IEPs, manages preschool special education programs, and supports over 400,000 students with disabilities.

nodes.label: Office of Higher Education
nodes.factoid: Oversees SUNY and CUNY systems, registers degree programs at private colleges, administers TAP financial aid, and regulates for-profit institutions.

nodes.label: Unemployment Insurance Division
nodes.factoid: Administers unemployment benefits to eligible workers, collects employer contributions, investigates fraud, and processes over 3 million claims during economic downturns.

nodes.label: Division of Employment and Workforce Solutions
nodes.factoid: Operates career centers statewide, provides job training programs, manages federal workforce development grants, and connects employers with job seekers.

nodes.label: Division of Safety and Health
nodes.factoid: Enforces workplace safety standards under PESH (Public Employee Safety and Health), conducts inspections, investigates accidents, and promotes occupational safety.

nodes.label: Division of Labor Standards
nodes.factoid: Enforces minimum wage, overtime, child labor laws, prevailing wage on public works, and investigates wage theft complaints from workers statewide.

nodes.label: Division of Criminal Justice
nodes.factoid: Prosecutes public corruption, organized crime, and major frauds, coordinates with local DAs, and manages special investigations including police misconduct cases.

nodes.label: Division of Economic Justice
nodes.factoid: Enforces consumer protection laws, prosecutes antitrust violations, investigates deceptive business practices, and recovers restitution for defrauded consumers.

nodes.label: Division of Social Justice
nodes.factoid: Enforces civil rights laws, investigates discrimination, protects nonprofit organizations, and litigates environmental justice and healthcare fraud cases.

nodes.label: Office of Operations and State Audit
nodes.factoid: Conducts performance and financial audits of state agencies, issues audit reports on program effectiveness, and identifies waste, fraud, and abuse in state operations.

nodes.label: Office of Local Government and School Accountability
nodes.factoid: Audits local governments and school districts, provides fiscal oversight, reviews budgets for fiscal stress, and offers technical assistance to municipalities.

nodes.label: Office of Retirement Services
nodes.factoid: Administers pension system for 1.1 million current and retired public employees, processes retirement applications, calculates benefits, and provides member services.

nodes.label: Office of Investment Management
nodes.factoid: Manages $250+ billion state pension fund investments across equities, bonds, real estate, and private equity, achieving returns to fund retirement obligations.

nodes.label: Operations Division
nodes.factoid: Maintains and operates 180 state parks and 35 historic sites, manages recreation programs, coordinates seasonal operations, and ensures visitor safety statewide.

nodes.label: Planning and Development Division
nodes.factoid: Plans capital improvements, designs park facilities, manages construction projects, and develops master plans for state parks and historic preservation.

nodes.label: Historic Preservation Division
nodes.factoid: Maintains historic sites, reviews development projects affecting historic resources under SEQRA, administers tax credit programs, and manages state and national registers.

nodes.label: Division of Food Safety and Inspection
nodes.factoid: Inspects food processing facilities, dairy farms, and retail food stores, enforces food safety standards, and regulates weights and measures across New York.

nodes.label: Division of Animal Industry
nodes.factoid: Monitors animal health, controls livestock diseases, inspects slaughterhouses, administers rabies control programs, and regulates animal imports into the state.

nodes.label: Division of Plant Industry
nodes.factoid: Protects crops from pests and diseases, inspects nurseries and greenhouses, enforces pesticide regulations, and manages agricultural pest control programs.

nodes.label: Budget Planning and Review
nodes.factoid: Prepares Governor's executive budget proposal, analyzes agency requests, develops financial plans, and monitors state spending throughout the fiscal year.

nodes.label: Budget Operations and State Financial Systems
nodes.factoid: Manages appropriation controls, processes budget amendments, maintains accounting systems, and produces financial reports on state revenues and expenditures.

nodes.label: Office of Capital Programming and Management
nodes.factoid: Develops state capital plan, reviews agency capital requests, monitors capital project execution, and manages debt issuance for infrastructure investments.

subviews.label: State Police Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational divisions within the New York State Police managing uniformed patrol, criminal investigations, and field operations

subviews.label: State DOT Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational offices within NYS Department of Transportation managing highway design, maintenance, construction, and safety programs

subviews.label: State DEC Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational divisions within the Department of Environmental Conservation managing air, water, forests, wildlife, and remediation programs

subviews.label: State Health Department Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational offices within NYS Department of Health managing public health, facility oversight, Medicaid, and primary care programs

subviews.label: State Education Department Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational offices within NYS Education Department managing curriculum, school operations, special education, and higher education oversight

subviews.label: State Labor Department Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational divisions within NYS Department of Labor managing unemployment insurance, workforce development, safety, and labor standards

subviews.label: Attorney General Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational divisions within the Attorney General's Office handling criminal justice, economic justice, and social justice matters

subviews.label: State Comptroller Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational offices within the State Comptroller managing state audits, local government oversight, retirement services, and pension investments

subviews.label: State Parks Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational divisions within the Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation managing park operations, planning, and historic preservation

subviews.label: State Agriculture & Markets Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational divisions within the Department of Agriculture and Markets managing food safety, animal health, and plant industry programs

subviews.label: State Budget Division Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational offices within the Division of the Budget managing budget planning, operations, and capital programming
